intro: Otopappus pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's pappus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a low-growing, herbaceous structure with narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and are adapted to attract pollinators in its harsh environment. Otopappus pringlei is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to survive in dry, sunny conditions.
